title: What does the Bible say about homosexuality? - Quora
tags: What Does The Bible Say About X?

response.answer_text: The Biblical stance is that all physical intimacy outside the bonds of Christian marriage is sinful. Most people stop reading right there, because their minds are already made up what to believe—but if you’ll allow me, let me also say a little more. If God is the Creator of life, and thus of human relationships, is it unreasonable that God should establish the boundaries for such things? Would it be reasonable of us to expect God to create sex, a wonderful and pleasurable gift, and then allow us to contort and pervert it in any way we see fit? The Bible makes the case that marriage is something God instituted as a symbol (a “type” in theological terminology) of God’s relationship with mankind. In the Book of Revelation and elsewhere in the New Testament, the Church is envisioned as the Bride of Christ, made holy by Jesus’ sacrifice, and ready to be joined to Christ for eternity. Jesus is the Bridegroom, faithfully loving God’s people, even in their disobedience and rebellion because they are redeemed by His sacrifice. Throughout Scripture, images of sexuality are used to depict holiness and righteousness versus corruption and sin. When a man and woman take each other as partners for this lifetime, their relationship is a witness about Christ and the Church. God intends for us to be in permanent, committed relationships where we love one another sacrificially, giving what it takes for the other’s good and even dying for one another if needed. Marriage means loving the other person even when your mate is difficult, unfaithful, or rebellious. It means always seeking the other person’s good over your own—because that’s what Christ has done for the Church. That said, the Bible nowhere suggests that homosexual adultery is worse than heterosexual adultery…but both condemn a person to destruction apart from redemption by the blood of Christ, and both can be repented of and forgiven and put away as far as east from west if we are saved by faith in Him. The grave error of the modern church is not only believing that homosexual sin is worse in God’s eyes, it’s the failure to see that ALL sin is deadly and will destroy us eternally apart from Jesus’ sacrificial death and the atonement He makes on our behalf.

The Bible tells us that homosexuality is a sin. Like any other sin, if we break one commandment it’s the same as any other commandment. So if we lie, steal, cheat, idolize something or someone, covet, kill, hate, or anything else, it is on the same level as homosexuality, as far as God goes. We don’t treat liars or cheaters like we do homosexuals, though, right? People make homosexuality into something WORSE and treat homosexuals like they are lepers and have to be kept outside the city, away from people, lest someone “catch” homosexuality or something. The dehumanizing treatment of homosexuals and others of the LGBT community by some Christians is horrible. And there are actual people in the LGBT community who believe in God and Jesus Christ. They are Christians. They might be dealing with this issue, and don’t know how to solve it, but they hold on to their faith while they work it out. It is not easy, and the feelings may never go away completely, but some people have managed to live this way. They take their beliefs seriously and Yahshua (Jesus) seriously, and know that their sexual preferences and feelings aren’t going away, so they deal with it and live with it. What else can they do? What the rest of Christianity needs to do is recognize them as human beings, regardless, and not treat them any differently than any other sinner. They are souls that need to be saved, not some animal than must be kept in a cage. I can’t say that the Bible doesn’t rather clearly tell us that homosexuality is a sin, but I do know something about God: He is God, and He knows and understands all, and He is a fair and just judge. Christians should support, fully, the spiritual development of those who are trying to be Christians while identifying as homosexual, bisexual, or any other “paraphilia”. That is what the church is for, and it isn’t their job to like it. It isn’t their job to understand it. They have to see sincere believers who are LGBT as part of them, the church and body of Christ, no matter what their problem. I’ve heard horror stories about this, immediately launching into exorcisms, for example. If a person in the church told a lie, would they do that crazy stuff? If they are not part of the body of Christ, how exactly would a member of the LGBT people WANT to convert, if that was their reception?
